member.name: T:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi
member.summary: You can interact with Players in your world through the VRCPlayerApi. Each Player has a VRCPlayerApi Object. The VRCPlayerApi Class also has static methods for getting various information about Players in the instance.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetPlayerCount
member.summary: Gets the number of Players in the instance when it is called.
member.returns: The number of players in the instance.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.IsValid
member.summary: If a player has left since you saved a reference to them, this will return False.
member.returns: True if the player is valid to use, false if it is not.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.EnablePickups(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Turn off the Player's ability to pickup and use VRCPickup objects in the world. This property is on by default, so you only need to use the method if you want to turn it off.

member.name: F:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.displayName
member.summary: Get the name displayed for the Player (can be different than Username, which is used to log into VRChat and not exposed publicly)
member.remarks: This value may return the string: "<uninitialized>" if the player is not valid.

member.name: F:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.isLocal
member.summary: Tells you whether the given Player is the local one.

member.name: P:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.isMaster
member.summary: Tells you whether the given Player is the instance master.
member.remarks: This is the player who either created the instance, or the one who inherited Master status when the last Master left.

member.name: P:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.isInstanceOwner
member.summary:
If the player is the owner of the instance. This isnt as straightforward as it seems, and a table is provided to explain it.
Instance Type Will be true for
Public World Uploader/Creator
Friends+ Instance Creator
Friends Instance Creator
Invite+ Instance Creator
Invite Instance Creator
Group+ Never
Group Never
Group Public Never
From testing and for future reference incase features are added, the name displayed when viewing a instance in instance details should be the "Instance Owner".
member.remarks: Will be False when in Build & Test and Unity Playmode.

member.name: P:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.isModerator
member.summary: if the player is a moderator. Currently unusable in udon

member.name: P:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.TakeOwnership(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Take ownership of a GameObject. Currently unusable in udon

member.name: P:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.isSuper
member.summary: if the player is a super user? Currently unusable in udon

member.name: P:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.AllPlayers
member.summary: Gets all the players in the instance as a list. Currently unusable in udon

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetPickupInHand(VRC.SDKBase.VRC_Pickup.PickupHand)
member.summary: Gets the pickup a Player is holding in the specified hand. Only works for the Local Player.
member.param: The hand to check for a pickup. . Any is not supported.
member.returns: The object the player is holding in the specified hand. Returns null if no VRCPickup is found.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.IsOwner(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Tells you whether a Player is the Owner of a given GameObject, important for Sync.
member.param: The GameObject to check ownership of.
member.returns: True if the player is the owner of the GameObject, false if they are not.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.IsUserInVR
member.summary: Tells you whether a Player is using a VR headset.
member.returns: True if the player is using a VR headset, false if they are not.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.PlayHapticEventInHand(VRC.SDKBase.VRC_Pickup.PickupHand,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Vibrate the Player's Haptic controllers if they have them.
member.remarks:
The feeling can vary quite a bit between controllers.
All 3 parameters MUST be positive.
member.param: The hand to vibrate. .
The duration of the vibration in seconds.
The amplitude of the vibration. 0.0 to 1.0.
The frequency of the vibration. 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.UseAttachedStation
member.summary: Makes the player get into the Station which is on the same GameObject as this UdonBehaviour.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.UseLegacyLocomotion
member.summary:
WARNING: This method is not recommended to be used.
turns on legacy locomotion for this player.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.CombatGetCurrentHitpoints
member.summary: NOT IMPLEMENTED AND NON-FUNCTIONAL! DO NOT USE!

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetCurrentLanguage
member.summary: Gets the selected language of the local user.
member.remarks: This feature isnt added to the client yet, so it currently is not useful.
member.returns: Currently returns a example string. Will throw an exception in clientsim currently.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetAvailableLanguages
member.summary: Gets all available languages a player can select.
member.remarks: This feature isnt added to the client yet, so it currently is not useful.
member.returns: Currently returns a example string[]. Will throw an exception in clientsim currently.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetPlayerCount
member.summary: Gets the actual number of Players in the instance when it is called.
member.remarks: This will return the value BEFORE the current function update. For example, if called in OnPlayerLeave, it will return the ammount of players in the instance right BEFORE that player left.
member.returns: The number of players in the instance.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetPlayers(VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi[])
member.returns: The populated VRCPlayerApi Array.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetPlayerById(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get a VRCPlayerApi object for the given player Id if it exists.
member.param: The player Id to get the VRCPlayerApi object for.
member.returns: The VRCPlayerApi object for the given player Id if it exists, null otherwise.

member.name: P:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.playerId
member.summary: Get the cached PlayerId, calls GetPlayerId if it hasn't been cached yet.
member.remarks: Currently, this seems to behave identically to .
member.value: The Network Id of the player. Always increments, even if the player leaves and rejoins.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetPlayerId(VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi)
member.summary: Gets the Player's Network Id from the source.
member.param: The player to get the Network Id for.
member.returns: The Network Id of the player. Always increments, even if the player leaves and rejoins.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetPlayerTag(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Sets a string variable that you can look up later.
For example, you could set the "role" of a player in a cooking game to "chef" or "customer". Then you could GetPlayerTag for "role" and get back either "chef" or "customer".
member.param: The name of the tag to set.
The value of the tag to set.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetPlayerTag(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of a tag that was set with SetPlayerTag.
member.param: The name of the tag to set.
member.returns: The value of the tag as a string.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.ClearPlayerTags
member.summary: Remove all tags that you've set on this player.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetPlayersWithTag(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: NOT CURRENTLY FUNCTIONAL! DO NOT USE, WILL THROW EXPOSURE EXCEPTION!
member.param: The name of the tag to get the players for.

The value of the tag to get the players for?????????
Unknown if this is even what it does.
member.returns: A list type of VRCPlayerApi objects that have the tag set.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetVoiceGain(System.Single)
member.summary: Add boost to the Player's voice in decibels.
member.param: in Decibels, Range 0-24. Default is 15.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetVoiceDistanceNear(System.Single)
member.summary: The near radius, in meters, where volume begins to fall off. It is strongly recommended to leave the Near value at zero for realism and effective spatialization for user voices.
member.param: in Meters, Range 0 - 1,000,000. Default is ???.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetVoiceDistanceFar(System.Single)
member.summary: This sets the end of the range for hearing the user's voice. You can lower this to make another player's voice not travel as far, all the way to 0 to effectively 'mute' the player.
member.param: in Meters, Range 0 - 1,000,000. Default is 25.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetVoiceVolumetricRadius(System.Single)
member.summary: A player's voice is normally simulated to be a point source, however changing this value allows the source to appear to come from a larger area.
member.remarks: This should be used carefully, and is mainly for distant audio sources that need to sound "large" as you move past them. Keep this at zero unless you know what you're doing. If you want a user's voice to sound like it is close no matter how far it is, increase the Voice Distance Near range to a large value.
member.param: in Meters, Range is 0 - 1,000. Default is 0. The value for Volumetric Radius should always be lower than Voice Distance Far.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetVoiceLowpass(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disables the low-pass filter on the player's voice.
member.remarks: When a voice is some distance off, it is passed through a low-pass filter to help with understanding noisy worlds. You can disable this if you want to skip this filter. For example, if you intend for a player to use their voice channel to play a high-quality DJ mix, turning this filter off is advisable.
member.param: True to enable? the low-pass filter, false? to disable it.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetAvatarAudioGain(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the Maximum Gain allowed on Avatar Audio.
member.param: in Decibels, Range 0-10. Default is 10.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetAvatarAudioFarRadius(System.Single)
member.summary: This sets the maximum end of the range for hearing the avatar's audio.
member.remarks: You can lower this to make another player's avatar audio not travel as far, all the way to 0 to effectively 'mute' the player. Note that this is compared to the audio source's maxDistance, and the smaller value is used.
member.param: in Meters, Range 0 - Single.MaxValue. Default is 40.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetAvatarAudioFarRadius(System.Single)
member.summary: This sets the maximum start of the range for hearing the avatar's audio.
member.param: in Meters, Range 0 - Single.MaxValue. Default is 0.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetAvatarAudioVolumetricRadius(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the Volumetric Radius of the Avatar's Audio.
member.remarks: An avatar's audio source is normally simulated to be a point source, however changing this value allows the source to appear to come from a larger area. This should be used carefully, and is mainly for distant audio sources that need to sound "large" as you move past them. Keep this at zero unless you know what you're doing. The value for Volumetric Radius should always be lower than .
member.param: in Meters, Range 0 - Single.MaxValue. Default is 0.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetAvatarAudioForceSpatial(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If this is on, then Spatialization is enabled for the source, and the spatialBlend is set to 1.
member.param: True to enable spatialization, false to disable it. Default is false.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetAvatarAudioCustomCurve(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This sets whether the audio source should use a pre-configured custom curve??????
member.param: True to enable the custom curve, false to disable it. Default is false.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetManualAvatarScalingAllowed
member.summary: Checks if the local player is allowed to control their avatar scale.
member.returns: if the local player is in the player-controlled avatar scaling mode, or false if they're in the world-authoritative avatar scaling mode.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetManualAvatarScalingAllowed(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Toggles between player-controlled and world-authoritative scaling modes.
member.param: true sets the player-controlled mode, and false sets the world-authoritative mode.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetAvatarEyeHeightMinimumAsMeters
member.summary: Returns the minimum eye height in meters that the local player is permitted to scale themselves to in the player-controlled avatar scaling mode.
member.returns: Greater than or equal to 0.2 meters.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetAvatarEyeHeightMinimumByMeters(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the minimum height in meters that the local player is permitted to scale themselves to in the player-controlled avatar scaling mode.
member.param: Must be greater than or equal to 0.2 meters.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetAvatarEyeHeightMaximumAsMeters
member.summary: Returns the maximum eye height that the local player is permitted to scale themselves to in the player-controlled avatar scaling mode.
member.returns: The maximum avatar eye height in meters.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetAvatarEyeHeightMaximumByMeters(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the maximum eye height in meters that the local player is permitted to scale themselves to in the player-controlled avatar scaling mode.
member.param: Must be less or equal to 5 meters.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetAvatarEyeHeightAsMeters
member.summary: Returns the configured eye height for the target player's avatar. This function works for the local player and remote players.
member.returns: The avatar eye height in meters.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetAvatarEyeHeightByMeters(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the eye height for the target player's avatar in meters. This function only works for the local player.
member.param: The avatar eye height in meters.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetAvatarEyeHeightByMultiplier(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the eye height using a multiplier of the target player's avatar eye height at its prefab scale. This function only works for the local player.
member.param: The avatar eye height as a multiple of the target player's avatar eye height at its prefab scale.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetWalkSpeed
member.summary: The speed at which a Player can walk around your world.
member.returns: The walk speed of the player.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetWalkSpeed(System.Single)
member.summary: The speed at which a Player can walk around your world.
member.param: The walk speed of the player. Set this below your Run Speed. Default is 2.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetRunSpeed
member.summary: The speed at which a Player can run around your world.
member.returns: The run speed of the player.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetRunSpeed(System.Single)
member.summary: The speed at which a Player can run around your world.
member.param: The run speed of the player. Set this above your walk Speed. Default is 4.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetStrafeSpeed
member.summary: The speed at which a Player can strafe around your world.
member.returns: The strafe speed of the player.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetStrafeSpeed(System.Single)
member.summary: The speed at which a Player can strafe around your world. Players speed when strafing is not affected by running.
member.param: The strafe speed of the player. Recommended to be set to the same as Walk Speed. Default is 2.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetJumpImpulse
member.summary: How much force applied when a player jumps.
member.returns: The jump impulse of the player. Default is 0.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetJumpImpulse(System.Single)
member.summary: How much force applied when a player jumps. Set this if you want to enable jump in your world. The default VRCWorld prefab sets this to 3.
member.param: The jump impulse of the player. Default is 0.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetGravityStrength
member.summary: Multiplier for the Gravity force of the world (set to Earth's default).
member.returns: The gravity strength of the player. Default is 1.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetGravityStrength(System.Single)
member.summary: Multiplier for the Gravity force of the world (set to Earth's default).
member.remarks: Don't change Unity's Physics.Gravity in your project, get and set it here instead if you are trying to affect the player.
member.param: The gravity strength of the player. Default is 1.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.Immobilize(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Keeps a Player stuck in place, turning off their Locomotion.
member.remarks: Note that VR Players may be able to move their viewpoint around a bit anyways, but their Avatar will stay in place.
member.param: True to immobilize the player, false to unimmobilize them.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetPosition
member.summary: Gets the position of the Player in world space.
member.returns: The position of the player in world space.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetRotation
member.summary: Gets the rotation of the Player in world space.
member.returns: The rotation of the player in world space.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetBoneTransform(UnityEngine.HumanBodyBones)
member.summary: Gets the transform of a bone in the Player's Avatar. Currently unusable in Udon, use and instead.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetBonePosition(UnityEngine.HumanBodyBones)
member.summary: Gets the position of the specified Bone in the Player's Avatar, or Vector3.Zero (0,0,0) if the bone does not exist.
member.remarks: Warning! This information can be frustrum-culled on remote players and may not be accurate if the local player cannot see the remote player. Note that Avatars may not have all the same bones in the places you expect, so be careful making assumptions about attributes like a player's height, pose etc based on the position of bones.
member.param: The bone to get the position of. see for a list of all bones you can check for.
member.returns: The position of the specified bone in the player's avatar in world space. Vector3.Zero (0,0,0) if the bone does not exist.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetBoneRotation(UnityEngine.HumanBodyBones)
member.summary: Gets the rotation of the specified Bone in the Player's Avatar, or Quaternion.Identity (0,0,0,1) if the bone does not exist.
member.remarks: Warning! This information can be frustrum-culled on remote players and may not be accurate if the local player cannot see the remote player. Note that Avatars may not have all the same bones in the places you expect, so be careful making assumptions about attributes like a player's height, pose etc based on the rotation of bones. Things like wrist rotation, or forward axis's of a hand have no set standard, so for one avatar it may be +X, for another it may be -Z. The only reliable rotation is from , however this only works on local players, so may require a more complex setup depending on your application.
member.param: The bone to get the rotation of. see for a list of all bones you can check for.
member.returns: The rotation of the specified bone in the player's avatar in world space. Quaternion.Identity (0,0,0,1) if the bone does not exist.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetTrackingData(VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.TrackingDataType)
member.summary: Gets a struct called TrackingData, which contains separate Position and Rotation data.
member.remarks: Warning! This information can be frustrum-culled on remote players and may not be accurate if the local player cannot see the remote player. This is the suggested way to get position and rotation data for a Player's head and hands. This returns data from the TrackingManager for a Local Player (ie the data coming from their headset / trackers) and from the RightHand, LeftHand and Head bones for a Remote Player. Origin returns the center of the local VR user's playspace, while returning the player's position for local Desktop users and all remote users. AvatarRoot returns data for the root transform of the avatar (the same transform that the player capsule is attached to). For users in Fully-Body Tracking, AvatarRoot will not rotate with the head facing direction. If you need data reflecting the general forward facing direction of a Player, consider using GetRotation instead.
member.param: The type of tracking data to get.
member.returns: The tracking data for the specified type. IMPORTANT WARNING: The returned tracking data will contain bone position/rotation if used on remote players when asking for things like controller position! The tracking data is only correct if used on the local player.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.GetVelocity
member.summary: Get the speed and direction of the player's movement.
member.returns: The velocity vector of the player in world space.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.SetVelocity(UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Set the speed and direction of the player's movement.
member.remarks: If SetVelocity is called on the local player, their 'IsGrounded' property is set to false since they are not in direct control of their movements while this is happening.
member.param: The velocity vector to set the player to.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.IsPlayerGrounded
member.summary: Get whether the player is touching the ground, which enables Jump.
member.remarks: This value is not reliable if the player is in a station
member.returns: True if the player is touching the ground, false if they are not.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.TeleportTo(UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Quaternion)
member.summary: Send a player to a new spot and specified rotation, unless a Station does not allow it.
member.param: The position to teleport the player to in world space.
The rotation to teleport the player to in world space.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.Respawn
member.summary: Respawns the player

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.Respawn(System.Int32)
member.summary: Respawns the player
member.param: The index of the respawn point to use

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.TeleportTo(UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Quaternion,VRC.SDKBase.VRC_SceneDescriptor.SpawnOrientation)
member.summary: Send a player to a new spot and specified rotation, unless a Station does not allow it.
member.param: The position to teleport the player to in world space.
The rotation to teleport the player to in world space.
How to align players with the destination position and rotation.

member.name: M:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.TeleportTo(UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Quaternion,VRC.SDKBase.VRC_SceneDescriptor.SpawnOrientation,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Send a player to a new spot and specified rotation, unless a Station does not allow it.
member.param: The position to teleport the player to in world space.
The rotation to teleport the player to in world space.
How to align players with the destination position and rotation.

Whether to interpolate the player's movement. If true, the teleportation is instantaneous and incurs and additional network bandwidth cost. If false, the teleportation is treated as normal player movement.

member.name: T:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.TrackingDataType
member.summary: The specific type of tracking data to get, IE hand position, head position, etc.
member.remarks: IMPORTANT NOTE: If relating to a remote player, the value will be from the players bones, NOT their actual tracking data

member.summary: The player's head tracking data

member.summary: The player's left hand tracking data

member.summary: The player's right hand tracking data

member.name: F:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.TrackingDataType.Origin
member.summary: Origin returns the center of the local VR user's playspace, while returning the player's position for local Desktop users and all remote users.

member.name: F:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.TrackingDataType.AvatarRoot
member.summary: AvatarRoot returns data for the root transform of the avatar (the same transform that the player capsule is attached to). For users in Fully-Body Tracking, AvatarRoot will not rotate with the head facing direction. If you need data reflecting the general forward facing direction of a Player, consider using GetRotation instead.

member.name: T:VRC.SDKBase.VRCPlayerApi.TrackingData
